intro: Ranunculus phaulanthus, commonly known as the desert buttercup, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic, flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow petals and simple, palmately divided leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers typically bloom in spring, adding a splash of color to its harsh desert environment.
